citation.article-title: Ilyobacter delafieldii sp. nov., a metabolically restricted anaerobic bacterium fermenting PHB

p.s: Description of Ilyobacter delafieldii sp. nov.
Ilyobacter delafieldii (de.la.field'di.i. ML gen. n. delafieldii of Delafield; named after F. P. Delafield, who isolated and studied PHB-degrading (aerobic) bacteria)
Rod-shaped cells, 0.4-0.5 x 2-10 μm in size, with pointed ends, normally occurring singly.
Under certain conditions extremely long chains of filamentous cells are formed.
Endospores not formed.
Gram-negative.
Peritrichous flagella, rapidly motile in young cultures.
Sudanophilic intracellular granules observed, but these are not PHB.
No cytochromes.
Chemoorganotrophic fermentative metabolism.
Crotonate, 3-hydroxybutyrate, poly-β-hydroxybutyrate, lactate and pyruvate fermented.
Acetate, propionate, butyrate, CO2 and H2 fermentation end products.
No other organic acids, sugars or alcohols metabolised.
Sulfate, sulfur, thiosulfate or nitrate not reduced.
No growth on butyrate with a hydrogenotroph.
Catalase, oxidase, indole from L-tryptophan, sulfide from cysteine, urea hydrolysis, esculin hydrolysis and gelatin hydrolysis all negative.
Extracellular PHB depolymerase present.
Selective enrichment in freshwater medium with 58 mM crotonate and 0.1 g/1 yeast extract.
Strictly anaerobic.
Media containing a reductant are necessary for growth.
Pyridoxamine and biotin required as growth factors; growth is good with 1.0 g/l yeast extract as a growth factor additive.
Range of pH for growth: 5.9 to 8.6, optimum at 7.8.
Temperature range 10-41°C, optimum at 40°C.
NaCl range: up to 40 g/l, optimum at trace.
DNA base ratio. 29 mol% G + C (thermal denaturation).
Habitat.
The type strain was isolated from anaerobic mud of estuarine origin.
Type strain. 10crl = DSM 5704, deposited with the Deutsche Sammlung von Mickroorganismen, Braunschweig, FRG.
